FacilityName: Maple Leaf Farms, Serenade Foods Division

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Maple Leaf Farms, Serenade Foods Division is a further processor of poultry products. We continuously strive to assure that our workers, neighbors and the environment are safe.

Maple Leaf Farms, Inc. has developed a Crisis Management Team to prepare for any emergency which may occur at any of the Maple Leaf Farms facilities.  Maple Leaf Farms Inc. is committed to protect their employees and the people of the surrounding community.

The only regulated chemical used by Maple Leaf Farms is anhydrous ammonia used in the refrigeration system.  There is approximately 20,600 lbs. of ammonia within the system. At most times the system charge is somewhat lower than this number.

As a part of our prevention plan, we have performed a worst case and alternate release scenario centered around the possibility of an ammonia release. Our worst and alternate case scenarios are described in a letter attached to the RMP Report.

Maple Leaf Farms, Serenade Foods Division has in place, a Process Safety Management / Risk Management Program. As a result of the PSM / RMP Program the following procedures and policies are in place:

     Employee Participation Guidelines

     Employee Training

     Contractor Qualification Guidelines

     Pre-Startup Procedures

     Mechanical Integrity Inspection Policy

     Support Personnel Entry Program

     Hot Work Permit Program

     Management of Change Program

     Incident Investigation Program

     Emergency Planning and Response Plan

     Compliance Audit Procedure

     Dissemination/Trade Secrets Policy

     Process Hazard Analysis

Annual Ammonia inspections are completed yearly and Mechanical Integrity inspections are completed every 5 years by an outside ammonia contractor. Any problems are documented and addressed and repaired as needed.

DESCRIPTION OF THE REFRIGERATION SYSTEM



Maple Leaf Farms-Serenade Division, Milford, Indiana is a poultry based processing and distribution facility. The facility incorporates a standard eva

poration and compression closed loop ammonia refrigeration system. The system is installed to operate as a two-temperature single stage system. The compressors are split as High Stage and Low Stage Compressors. There exists, two different levels of saturated suction temperatures. Each level of suction temperature services a specific area of the plant.





SUMMARY OF THE FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



Maple Leaf Farms Serenade Foods Division has not had a release in excess of 100 pounds of ammonia in the last five years.

DESCRIPTION OF THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN



Warsaw HAZMAT Team is our primary response in the event of a catastrophic release or a release at night or on weekends.  They have toured our facilities and given us a hazard analysis.  We will be having drills twice yearly to familiarize the team with the equipment and procedures to be followed.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Because of executive support Maple Leaf Farms Serenade Foods Division maintains a comprehensive PSM / RMP program. This support allows our PSM / RMP team to have the freedom to make necessary improvements as they are identified.

Maple Leaf Farms Serenade Foods Division provides certification training opportunities for employees directly and indirectly involved with the ammonia refrigeration system through courses offered by 3rd party consultants. This provides a better understanding of the operation of our ammonia refrigeration system allowing for safe operation of the system.
